title: Cospectral trees indistinguishable by scattering
abstract:
Let v_1 and v_2 be two distinct vertices of a tree T_0. Let \phi_N^{(i)}
(i=1,2) be the characteristic functions of the Sturm-Liouville problem on T_0
rooted at v_i with Neumann conditions at the root and let \phi_D^{(i)} (i=1,2)
be the characteristic functions of the Sturm-Liouville problem on T_0 with
Dirichlet conditions at the root. We prove that if attaching any tree to T_0 at
the vertices v_1 and v_2 leads to cospectral trees and d(v_1)=d(v_2) then
\phi_N(\lambda)^{(1)}\equiv \phi_N(\lambda)^{(2)} and
\phi_D(\lambda)^{(1)}\equiv \phi_D(\lambda)^{(1)} (which means that the
scattering is the same at v_1 and v_2).
